Type Aliases

Plane

Plane: { normal: math.vec.Vector3; point: math.vec.Vector3 }
brief

The definition of a plane in 3D

Type declaration

  • normal: math.vec.Vector3
  • point: math.vec.Vector3

V2

V2: [number, number]

V3

V3: [number, number, number]

Extrude Functions

extrude

  • extrude(trace: TraceInfo): SurfaceType

  • Extruce a 2D/3D trace using the dip angle, dip-direction and a depth.

    Example:

    const trace = {
         is: "1",
         dip: 35,
         dipDirection: 135,
         depth: 1000,
         rows: 5,
         points: Serie.create({array: [0,0, 0,1, 0,2, 1,3, 2,4], itemSize: 2})
    }
    const surface = extrude(trace)
    console.log(surface.positions, surface.indices)

    Parameters

    • trace: TraceInfo

    Returns SurfaceType

mapToMnt

  • mapToMnt(mnt: SurfaceType, traces: TraceInfo[]): Serie<IArray>[]

  • Map 2D or 3D segments onto a mnt

    Parameters

    • mnt: SurfaceType

      The mnt given by the [[Serie]] positions and indices

    • traces: TraceInfo[]

      An array of [[TraceInfo]]

    Returns Serie<IArray>[]

    An array of [[Serie]]

createBackgroundGrid2D

  • createBackgroundGrid2D(__namedParameters: { dims?: [number, number]; eps?: number; indices: Serie<IArray>; positions: Serie<IArray> }): BackgroundGrid2D

  • Put all cells from a 2D unstructured mesh (not the points) into a background-brid

    see

    BackgroundGrid2D

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { dims?: [number, number]; eps?: number; indices: Serie<IArray>; positions: Serie<IArray> }
      • Optional dims?: [number, number]
      • Optional eps?: number
      • indices: Serie<IArray>
      • positions: Serie<IArray>

    Returns BackgroundGrid2D

extractSurfaceBorders

  • extractSurfaceBorders(positions: Serie<IArray>, indices: Serie<IArray>): Serie

  • Get borders ([[Serie]]) as pair of two 3D nodes, i.e., [x11,y11,z11, x12,y12,z12, x21,y21,z21, x22,y22,z22, ...]

    Parameters

    • positions: Serie<IArray>
    • indices: Serie<IArray>

    Plane fitting to many 3D points

generateEllipse

  • generateEllipse(__namedParameters: { a: number; b: number; center?: number[]; density?: number; nbRings?: number }): DataFrame

  • Generate a meshed ellipse made of nbRings rings. The number of points in a ring is function of the number of rings: nbNodes = ringIndex * density, with ringIndex starting from 1 and ending at nbRings.

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { a: number; b: number; center?: number[]; density?: number; nbRings?: number }
      • a: number
      • b: number
      • Optional center?: number[]
      • Optional density?: number
      • Optional nbRings?: number

    Returns DataFrame

generatePointInPolygon

  • generatePointInPolygon(polyline: Serie<IArray>, maxThrows?: number): [number, number]

  • Parameters

    • polyline: Serie<IArray>
    • maxThrows: number = 100

    Returns [number, number]

generateRectangle

  • generateRectangle(__namedParameters: { a: number; b: number; center?: number[]; na: number; nb: number }): DataFrame

  • Generate a meshed rectangle

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { a: number; b: number; center?: number[]; na: number; nb: number }
      • a: number
      • b: number
      • Optional center?: number[]
      • na: number
      • nb: number

    Returns DataFrame

generateSphere

  • generateSphere(subdivision: number, __namedParameters?: { shared?: boolean; typed?: boolean }): { indices: IArray; positions: IArray } | { indices: number[]; positions: number[] }

  • Return two typed array for the faces and the vertices making a sphere given by a subdivision. Note that all triangles are decoupled.

    {
         position: Float32Array,
         indices : Int16Array
    }
    example
    import { generateSphere, Surface } from '@youwol/geometry

    const {positions, indices} = generateSphere(10)
    console.log('nb vertices :', positions.count)
    console.log('nb triangles:', indices.count)

    const surface    = Surface.create(positions, indices)

    // const archSrface = new arch.Surface(positions.array, indices.array)

    Parameters

    • subdivision: number

      The number of subdivision (>0)

    • __namedParameters: { shared?: boolean; typed?: boolean } = {}
      • Optional shared?: boolean
      • Optional typed?: boolean

    Returns { indices: IArray; positions: IArray } | { indices: number[]; positions: number[] }

generateStreamLinesFromUnstructured

  • generateStreamLinesFromUnstructured(__namedParameters: { dSep?: number; dTest?: number; indices: Serie<IArray>; maxTimePerIteration?: number; maximumPointsPerLine?: number; nx?: number; ny?: number; positions: Serie<IArray>; seeds?: number[]; timeStep?: number; vectorField: Serie<IArray> }): DataFrame[]

  • Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { dSep?: number; dTest?: number; indices: Serie<IArray>; maxTimePerIteration?: number; maximumPointsPerLine?: number; nx?: number; ny?: number; positions: Serie<IArray>; seeds?: number[]; timeStep?: number; vectorField: Serie<IArray> }
      • Optional dSep?: number
      • Optional dTest?: number
      • indices: Serie<IArray>
      • Optional maxTimePerIteration?: number
      • Optional maximumPointsPerLine?: number
      • Optional nx?: number
      • Optional ny?: number
      • positions: Serie<IArray>
      • Optional seeds?: number[]
      • Optional timeStep?: number
      • vectorField: Serie<IArray>

    Returns DataFrame[]

    • eps: number = 1e-7

pointInPolygon

  • pointInPolygon(x: number, y: number, polyline: Serie<IArray>): boolean

  • If the polygon is given by 3D points, set the flag hasZ to true. The z component will be discarded.

    Usage:

    const polygon = [1, 1,  1, 2,  2, 2,  2, 1]
    console.log( pointInPolygon(1.5, 1.5, polygon)) // true
    console.log( pointInPolygon(4.9, 1.2, polygon)) // false
    console.log( pointInPolygon(1.8, 1.1, polygon)) // true
    note

    based on https://wrf.ecse.rpi.edu/Research/Short_Notes/pnpoly.html

    Parameters

    • x: number
    • y: number
    • polyline: Serie<IArray>

    Returns boolean

project

  • project(p: Vector3 | Serie<IArray>, plane: Plane): number[] | Serie<IArray>

  • Project a 3D vector onto the plane and get the in-plane coordinates (2D)

    Parameters

    • p: Vector3 | Serie<IArray>

      The point to project

    • plane: Plane

      The plane

    Returns number[] | Serie<IArray>

    coordinates

relaxMesh

  • relaxMesh(positions: Serie<IArray>, indices: Serie<IArray>, iterations?: number, damp?: number): Serie

  • Beautify a flat triangulated surface

    Parameters

    • positions: Serie<IArray>
    • indices: Serie<IArray>
    • iterations: number = 100
    • damp: number = 0.1

    Returns Serie

reverseNormals

  • reverseNormals(indices: Serie<IArray>): Serie

  • Reverse les normals given in a Serie.

    example
    import { reverseNormals } from '@youwol/geometry'
    import { decodeGocadTS } from '@youwol/io'

    const surfaces = io.decodeGocadTS(buffer)

    // Reverse all the normals for all the loaded surfaces
    surfaces.forEach( surface => {
         surface.indices = reverseNormals(surface.indices)
    })
    caterogy

    dataframe

    Parameters

    • indices: Serie<IArray>

      The indices of the triangles as a serie (flat-array)

    Returns Serie

    The new indices as a serie

simplify

  • simplify(points: Serie<IArray>, tolerance?: number, highestQuality?: boolean): Serie<IArray>

  • From Simplify.js, a high-performance JS polyline simplification library.

    Polyline simplification dramatically reduces the number of points in a polyline while retaining its shape, giving a huge performance boost when processing it and also reducing visual noise. For example, it's essential when rendering a 70k-points line chart or a map route in the browser using Canvas or SVG.

    github

    mourner.github.io/simplify-js

    copyright

    2013, Vladimir Agafonkin

    license

    BSD-2-Clause "Simplified" License

    Parameters

    • points: Serie<IArray>

      Can be either 2D or 3D points defined in a Serie

    • tolerance: number = 1
    • highestQuality: boolean = false

    Returns Serie<IArray>

fromNodeToTriangle

  • fromNodeToTriangle(__namedParameters: { indices: Serie<IArray>; positions: Serie<IArray>; serie: Serie<IArray> }): Serie

  • Linear interpolate any Serie of any itemSize from nodes to triangles using topological information.

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { indices: Serie<IArray>; positions: Serie<IArray>; serie: Serie<IArray> }

      • positions: Serie<IArray>

  • fromTriangleToNode(__namedParameters: { indices: Serie<IArray>; positions: Serie<IArray>; serie: Serie<IArray> }): Serie
